column4: i have 2 free space partitions, a 20gb once which is part of an extended partition and a 50gb partition when has never been formatted. how do i 'merge' this free space?
in Windows, you could use Partition Magic..
I didn't have too good experience with qtparted.. I recommend partition magic..
once i get it installed, what will i do next
the program is realy easy to use.. no need to read manuals..
what command should i use to list the partition table (fdisk -l just shows the formatted partitions)
but yuo asked me to tell you what they are
there is Windows PE Iso floating around with good system software like partition magic.. no need to install Windows
that probably won't be possible...since partition has to be in contigous sector.
same time.. just move important stuff to CD/DVD or another drive..
but thats not what i want to do, i need to backup an xp partition with the freespace
if you just want to backup, I recommend Norton Ghost.. I am pretty sure there is linux equivalent, so help.
no its not to backup, its to use for booting
also I think you'll run into problem if you really mess your parttion with Win XP...
well maybe someone can get it working
no. it can copy an ubuntu partition
